captions.text: Gorky Film Studio
SEVENTEEN MOMENTS OF SPRING
Part 8
Don't turn on the light!

How did you get into my house? 
And why may I not turn on the light?

-And who are you afraid of? 
-Not of you. That's for sure.
Walk slow and carefully please.

- Be careful, an armchair is ahead. 
- I've already learned what's in your house.

- It is comfortable and quiet in your house. 
- And especially during air bombing raids.

My back is killing me. I caught cold 
somehow and am dead tired.
Should have some aspirin.

In such a darkness instead of aspirin 
I could drink a laxative by mistake.

Let's pull down the blinds 
and light up the fireplace.

I tried, but couldn't pull your blinds down. 
Here, at your house, they have a secret.

There is no secret here at all. 
Now tell me what happened, my old friend?

- Whom are you so afraid of? 
- I am afraid of Muller.

- Of your boss? 
- Precisely.

So, what did happen for the 
past 2 days, while I was away?

The God descended on the Earth? 
Or Kaltenbrunner married a Jew?

Like I said, don't turn on the light.
I removed electric fuses altogether.

It is possible that there are 
microphones installed in your house.

- Installed by whom? 
- By my department.

- What do you mean by that? 
- That's why I came to you to talk.
If you are so afraid of hidden cameras,

you can hide yourself in the corner over there. 
That way no one will see you.
I will go and have some aspirin.
Did you have your aspirin at last?

Now sit down. There is little time, 
and we need to discuss many issues.

-Why does it make this strange sound? 
-It's always like that. Heated it ceases the noise.

-Well, now, what do you have to tell me? 
-Me to you? Nothing.

-What are you going to do? 
-What do you mean by that?

I actually intended to take a 
hot bath and to go to bed.
I am chilled and tired.

-I came here as your friend. 
-That's enough!

You are acting like a boy with all the secret 
fog around! Maybe your name's Monte- Kristo?

-Would you like a drink? 
-Yes, I would love one.

-You have a good cognac. -Want some more? 
-With a great pleasure.

Shtirlitz, for the past week I was 
investigating your personal file.
I don't understand what you are saying!

Muller ordered me to secretly to inspect your 
work with the German nuclear physicists.

Why are you talking to me like this? 
It is not yet clear to me.

Please explain to me, what do I have 
to do with those arrested physicists?
Or explain why Muller is investigating me!

I cannot explain that yet, because 
I myself don't understand everything yet.

But I know that you are under his 
serious investigation.
Me? Why me? No, this is a total idiocy.

Seems that our bosses have entirely 
lost their minds in this confusion?

You taught me to be patient and calm,
but now you are loosing it yourself.

You tell me to be calm after 
what you just told me.
Yes, you're right. I am not calm.

I am upset, surprised and agitated. 
I am going to talk to Muller right now!

He's sleeping right now. Don't rush 
to see him. Just listen to me first.

I'ill explain what I've discovered about
you in connection to German physicists.

I did not yet tell this to Muller.
I wanted to talk to you first.
All right. Go ahead. I am listening.

I called 3 experts from the department 
of the development of new armaments.

I called for those experts as well, 
when "YOU" jailed physicist Runge.

Yes, "WE" jailed Runge, but why you were 
dealing with him in the first place?
Is it incomprehensible for you?

Runge studied in France and the States. 
Is it still difficult for you to surmise,

that his personal connections there are
more important than he himself here?

He ruins himself by the absence of impudence 
in the promising vision of physical problems.

We cannot afford idle dreams! 
Not a step away from the path to success!
That is correct.
But I would argue some fine details.

Runge tried to convince others 
to continue the research of

possibilities of obtaining Plutonium 
from the highly active elements,

namely this imputed to him as his fault 
by his scientific opponents.
So they wrote a denunciation again him.

- I made them to tell the truth about it. 
- I never had any doubts about that.

- Doubts about what? 
- That they wrote that denunciation.

Also, why were you working with his 
case such a very long time?

And then, why, as a result of your 
actions, Runge was removed from his work?

I had to verify that Runge is doing a 
good job. And if “yes”, then is his

work beneficial more for us or 
for our enemies?

So you concluded that his work is 
more beneficial for our enemies?

- You have read the case materials yourself. 
- Yes, I've read them all.

But now all the scientists discovered 
that Runge was right after all.

Americans and Englishmen used his ideas and 
got ahead. But he was jailed in our Gestapo.

In "YOUR" Gestapo. It's not us who put him
there. It's "YOUR service" put him in jail.

WE, the intelligence, did not do it, 
but Muller and Kaltenbrunner did.

Neither mine nor your grandmother was a Jew.
His was. He intentionally hid it from us.

I personally don't give a crap even if his 
grandfather, too, was a Jew three times!

A Jew or not a Jew! Who cares!
What difference does it make now?

It is unimportant, who his grandfather was.
What important is, that he did serve us.

- You believed traitors and scoundrels! 
- Scoundrels...

They are the old members of the Nazi movement!
They are verified true Aryans,

The physicists, who were personally 
awarded by the Fuhrer himself.

It is correct. You are right again. 
Give me more cognac, please.
What did you do with my electric fuses?
What do you mean?
Where did you hide them?
What do you think will Kaltenbrunner do,

if I report to him the results of 
my investigation?
Firstly you must report this to Muller.

- He gave an order for Runge's arrest. 
- But you interrogated Runge first.

I interrogated him first, 
that is accurate.

Under management's directions, 
carrying out my orders.

If you would have let him go, we
would be ahead in the creation of

nuclear "weapons of retribution", 
but now we have nothing instead.

- Can you prove that accusation? 
- I have already proved it.

-And all our physicists agree with you? 
-The vast majority of them.
All of the physicists that I talked to.

- Something very bad will happen to you now ... 
- Nothing will happen to me at all!

Results of scientific research are
confirmed only by practical implementations.

- Where are those confirmations and proofs? 
- They are right here in my pocket.

- Are you sure about that? 
- I am absolutely sure about that.

I obtained from our spies in London 
some secret information about you.

This is a death sentence for sure. 
A death sentence to you.

What are you trying to get from me
right here and right now, Holtoff?

You give crazy hints, but still,
I cannot understand you at all.

Intentionally or unintentionally, but
precisely you and only you alone are

responsible for failures in the developments
of our nuclear "weapons of retribution."

Intentionally or unintentionally, 
but you personally and only you,

instead of talking to 100s of physicists,  
you talked to 10, and, based on

their bias opinion, and they were 
interested in the isolation of Runge,

you concluded that Runge's ideas 
must be acknowledged as unfounded.

Are you telling me now that I should not
have trusted devoted soldiers of the Fuhrer?

Keitel and Goering still do trust 
those physicists fully.

Instead you want me to trust a person, who
is for a foreign way of nuclear development?
Do you want me to do that instead?

You want me to trust some unknown Runge, 
who's arrested by the Gestapo, by the way.

And as we know, the Gestapo does not
arrest anyone without a serious reason.

You want me not to believe the people, 
who helped us in uncovering him.

Everything in your words appears 
very logical as usual.
I always envied your great skills

to be able to precisely erect 
a logical directivity.

You neutralize Muller, who
originally ordered to arrest Runge,

and then you neutralize me, 
who seems protecting Jews.

And you become the monument of 
our Nazi faith on our bones.

It's all very accurate, but who cares. 
I came here for something different.

Yes, Runge, is still in the 
concentration death camp,

but he lives in a separate nice 
little house of the SS guards town.

He has all the opportunities to be 
occupied by the theoretical physics.

Now I will tell you the main 
reason why I am here.
I got into a terrible cross fire.

If I report the results of 
my investigation to Muller,

he will understand that you, even 
though you are under suspicion now,

and you are investigated by more
people than just me alone,

you will possess a serious 
argument against him.

Yes, that is precisely the fact, that
he gave out the order to arrest Runge.

So if I report, the results of the 
investigation that are against you,
they will indirectly impact him too.

I will be getting the cross fire 
impacts from both sides.

Muller will strike me first 
and you will do it after him.

He, Muller, because my findings 
must, still, be double-checked,
and you... Well...

You already described to me how
you will twist the truth against me.

So, what should I, the officer 
of the Gestapo, do?

Please help me with the answer, 
you, the intelligence officer.
Do you want to "leave the game"?

You in my place, probably, would start
thinking about that too, wouldn't you?
I cannot answer this right now,

before I can clearly hear 
your "yes" or "no".

Well, what if, we would assume the 
impossible, and I would answer "yes"?
If you start assuming the impossible,
then you got a wrong address.

You, then, better go to an
astrologer, not to me.
Do you have a "window" on the border?
Maybe.

What if we leave, the three of us, 
together to a neutral country illegally?

- Who are "the three of us"? 
- It is Runge, you and me.

We will save a great physicist for 
the world. I already saved him here,

and you will organize his escape
from Germany to Switzerland.

How is my plan? And remember that you
are still under investigation by me.

You well know what it means to be 
"under the cap" of Muller.
Well? Now, I await you answer.

- Would you like another drink? 
- I would love to.

Holtoff spoke untruth, when he
said that Muller was sleeping already.

Muller was not sleeping at all. 
He awaited Holtoff's return with results.

He received a report from the center
of decoding about the events in the

former Russian spy apartment in Bern, 
Switzerland, controlled now by the Gestapo.

Comparing the ciphers, he made 
an essential discovery.

From the presentiment of success, he
even suddenly felt pain in the head.

The ciphers of the Russian radio 
woman coincided with the

received ciphers from the 
spy messenger in Bern, Switzerland.

Would you explain why do I always
have a problem with this drawer?

- Do you have spare keys? 
- No.

Bring me a magnifying glass.
Mine is in this drawer.
Muller's speaking.
Yes, boss, of course I will.
Certainly, sir.
We've got something very interesting.

I just received a report from
the center of decoding.

We discovered that the ciphers of 
the Russian radio operator coincide

with the ciphers of their spy
messenger in Bern, Switzerland.

Yes, we did identify the messenger.
It is professor Pleyshner from Germany.

This means that the main spy,  
"the resident", is still here in Berlin

and he is desperately looking for new
means to connect to his spy Center.

Yes, I still will stay here 
at work for a while.
What does this mean? How dare you!

Are you completely out of your
god damned mind, Shtirlitz?

I am in the right mind, sir. But he,
either out of his mind either...

Either he decided to "leave the game" and
run off to a foreign country.

What the hell are you talking about? 
Are you totally crazy?
Give him some water. Quick!
Now. What the hell did actually happen?

Excuse me, gruppenfyurer, but
let him explain everything first.

And I would better put it
in writing my report.

OK. Now go to your office and write
me a report about all what's happened.
How much time will you require for this?

If it's briefly then 10 minutes. 
If it's in details then by tomorrow.

- Why by tomorrow? 
- I have some urgent matters.

And also... earlier than tomorrow 
he will not get better anyway.
All right then, tomorrow by 9 AM!

Remove his handcuffs, put some 
bandages and bring him home.
Muller rarely was making mistakes.

He served in the Weimar Republic, 
thrashing the rally of the Nazis,

then he switched over to the Nazis and 
began killing the Weimar Republic's leaders,

after that he started carrying out 
Himmler's killing orders,

and now he started gravitating 
towards Kaltenbrunner's work style.

And each time his gift of an excellent 
police detective would not ever fail him.

Hardly Kaltenbrunner forgot about 
his special request to Muller

to investigate cases that
were lead by Shtirlitz.
That meant, something did happen
and, apparently, at the high levels,

and the highest level for him
was Martin Bormann himself.

Therefore Muller charged Holtoff 
with an order to go to Shtirlitz
and conduct a provocative "game".

If Shtirlitz would have arrived tomorrow  
and describe the behavior of Holtoff,

then he could quietly place the case 
into the safe, considering it closed.

If Shtirlitz would have agreed to 
the proposal of Holtoff,

then he, Muller, could report to 
Kaltenbrunner about that,
relying on the data of his officer.

And such a report would be not a 
chimera with physical formulas.

What has just occurred here, 
was totally unforeseen

and it could not satisfy any of
the expected outcomes tonight.

Obeying to an old habit to bring 
all matters to a proper finish,

rather than suspecting Shtirlitz, 
Muller called for Sholtz.

Copy the finger prints from
this water glass.

If I fall asleep - don't wake me up.
I think there will be nothing urgent.

- Is there anything new? 
- No, shtandartenfyurer, sir!
And how is behaving our Russian friend?

We spend time in interesting 
ideological discussions with her.

I am certain that you do gain 
victory each time over her.

But please leave her a chance to 
feel herself as a worthy opponent.

Please bring me some coffee, 
if it is possible.

Our coffee here is unsavory.
A substitute. May be some tea instead?

- We have a very good tea. 
- Then please make it strong.

Continue wait and listen to 
possible radio signals from Moscow.

I will return after-tomorrow 
and I think that by then
your fate will become clearer.

No need to worry. All issues are
coordinated with my management.
Barbara, I have very little time.

The forces of the 3rd Belorussian Front
today, on 15 March, 1945
conducted combat in Koenigsberg region.

The forces of the 3rd Ukrainian Front
completed Balaton lake operation,
which begun on 6 March, 1945.

In the course of heavy combats and 
counter attacks the Russian troops stopped

attempts of the enemy to inflict defeat 
on the Russian troops in Hungary

and to raise the blockade of 
German Budapest army group.

A significant role in the disruption of
the counter attack of the enemy troops
played aviation of the 17th Air Army.

There were created favorable 
conditions to liberate Vienna.

I am sorry I have to leave you now. 
Please continue the conversation.
Tomorrow evening we shall meet again.

We had useful and promising
negotiations so far.
What interests me now is this:

Tell me whom would you see as the 
chancellor of the future Germany?
Kesselring.
Kesselring and him only!

He is popular among the German people. 
He is mature and brave.

- And the Minister of Foreign Affairs? 
- Von Neyrad.

- He's the ex-governor of Czechoslovakia? 
- Yes.

- He was obergruppenfyurer SS? 
- We all are in SS and belong to SS.
I understand.
So, Von Neyrad then.

And who will be the Minister 
of the Finances?

Is Mr Schaht the one, who can be
the Minister of the Finances?
It is correct, although he is a sly fox.

To be an artless financier means 
to end up with bankruptcy.
He financed Hitler political complain.

Hitler was back then only known by 
his real last name- Schicklgruber.

Hitler even back then was the Hitler. 
And he wasn't called Schicklgruber anymore.

And who will be the Minister 
of the Internal Affairs?
Who will hold Germany in strong hands?

Will it be the mighty Mr. Wolf himself? 
Is it going to be you, General Karl Wolf?
Obergruppenfurer SS Karl Wolf.
The sooner you forget about the SS

and the titles in the hierarchy 
within the SS troops,

the better will be not only for us, but, 
believe me, and for you also.

And where do you see in the future
a position of your current direct boss?
Are you talking about Kaltenbrunner?
No. About Himmler.

This will be determined during further
stages of our negotiations.

Right now I can promise to you, that 
the legality will be observed.

Let's try to forget about the SS titles 
and remember only names at this stage.
Because

the SS titles are not the 
main thing right now!

To stop Russian Bolsheviks and not
let them conquer the Europe

that's what I, personally, see 
as the most important thing right now!
Only that and nothing else.

Well, this represents a total drop in
the morality. I am totally against that.

I am hearing her singing now and trying
to recall church music by Handel or Bach.

It's apparent, that art was more 
demanding to itself in the past.

The art in the past was next to 
faith in its natural beauty.
Now it is all gone.

Just listen to how she is singing. 
That's how they talk on the markets.

This singing woman will be famous one day.
She will be remembered long after death.
Your views are simply too liberal.

No. It is because I love Paris 
and I just love it so much.

And I fell in love with Paris
a long time ago, my dear pastor.

Shtirlitz was in France not long before 
it was occupied by the German fascists.

He forever memorized the leaving troops, 
who decided to continue their fight
even if they'd be outside France.
In 2 hours we will be at the border line.

Please repeat to me everything that you 
must do for me in Bern, Switzerland.

I have a good memory. 
The Bible teaches not only kindness,
but also a precise organization of memory.

Nevertheless, you'll repeat to me everything. 
With details. From the beginning to the end.

I must stay in the hotel "Savoy".
Then I must...

"He actually does have a good memory," -
thought Shtirlitz
considering his age and his life situation.

He will begin playing his part 
in the show and very soon.
Now it's the time to take care of Ket.

If something unforeseen would happen, 
and this could happen any time now,

she will not carry out tortures and
would tell them all about me.

But the pastor will already begin his part
and Pleyshner will carry out my commission.

And not one of them knows, what was
their part in the entire operation.

The pastor will be observed by my people, 
who received my message with Pleyshner.

And everything will be in the order. 
These negotiations will not happen.

I will not let Himmler to continue
those secret negotiations.

No, you meet with him in the blue 
room, not in the pink room.

You see, your memory is not that good 
anymore, so let's repeat everything again.

It's funny, it seemed to me that 
you don't even listen to me.

No, I do. I am listening very carefully.
Please let's continue.

The pastor today will be in Switzerland, 
and then he'll take care of my business.

Why "my business"? It's our mutual 
business to be more precise.

While the pastor is there working for me,
I'll be able to pull out Ket and save her.

After that I could go underground. Disapear. 
They are closing on me. That's for sure.
And not even Bormann would save me then.

I'll leave through my "window" on the border, 
if the game has approached its end.

- Is this correct? 
- It is correct.

It is good that you focused your 
attention on small details

Only get into the second taxi car, 
passing the first one,

And by no account do you get into a random 
car offering a ride on the street.

I hope that you remember that the
people from the monastery are agents
will be watching every step of yours.
I want to remind you again
that anything can happen to you

if you allow even a very tiny 
carelessness in your work.

You will not even notice how quickly you
would end up in Muller's torture dungeon.

So if this ever occurs, 
you must keep in mind that
If my name is ever pronounced by you,

in your delirium or under the torture, 
indicates my absolute immediate death,

and together with me there'll be an immediate 
death of your sister and your nephews.

They hang on me and the others like me, 
who made it possible for you to leave now.

Nothing can save your relatives if only once
you would pronounce my name to anyone.

This is not a threat to scare you. 
Understand me correctly.

This is the ugly reality, 
and it must be known.

And you need to remember 
about it always.
I perfectly understand you.

I don't want in this important matter
you would incorrectly understand me.

- Start changing your clothes. 
- In a second. My hands shake a little.

- I am a little nervous. 
- You may talk normally.
No one here can hear us.

Repeat to me again the address, to
which you will write to our friends.
I remember it well.
It fits exactly. Just amazing!

- Repeat again the secret address. 
- Bertha Yuhansons, 7 Svevegen street,

- Stockholm, Sweden. 
- That is correct.
Repeat the exact text of the message,

If the negotiations between Himmler 
and the Western allies have begun.

"Aunt Elsa from Lausanne visited us in Bern. 
She feels very well here. But she

does miss home and each week she writes 
letters home. Love, your Gustav".

Repeat the message that you will
send if there are no negotiations yet.

I'll write then: "Do not believe 
those, who frighten you with a bad

weather in Switzerland right at this time. 
It's very sunny and warm here ".
I hate the official words, dear pastor.

On the information that you'll discover 
and on your secret messages about it,
may depend the future of Germany.

And not only of Germany alone. 
I wish you good luck, my dear pastor.

Go towards the sound of a power station. 
The hotel is right near it.
This is not more than two kilometers.
God bless your soul.

Shtirlitz suddenly felt a sharp pain 
that just pinched his entire heart.

He realized that poor pastor Shlag 
doesn't know how to use skis at all.

At least, for the past 10 years he didn't 
even hold ski sticks in his old hands.

"He’ll be OK" - thought Shtirlitz, 
"The hotel is not far. He'll make it".

"Now it's necessary to resolve the most
important matter"- thought Shtirlitz.

"Now the main thing is to save Ket"
- thought Shtirlitz.

It will be necessary for me to 
utilize your aid in this matter.

Firstly in Sweden 
and then in Switzerland.

No. Whatever's known to two, is known 
then to everyone, even to dirty pigs.

Thank you, you are a true friend.
You always save me.

I respect that and am always 
grateful for your help.
Well, what's the news?

On the water glass in your office,
on the Russian spy radio suitcase

and on the telephone in the room of 
special Government connections

there were the finger prints 
of the same person.
It is shtandartenfurer SS Shtirlitz.

I requested to purchase Swedish blades. 
Where the hell are they? What the hell!

- Where did they make the discovery? 
- In the fifth special subdivision.

I'm getting old. Scleroses, I guess.
I'm ringing for you, but you're here.

Immediately send Rolf to me.
Send a car for him now.

Let him interrogate the Russian 
radio woman his hard way.

Check all roads to Shtirliz' house.
Send troops to ambush his house.

If he is now inside his house, 
do not arrest him there.

Instead, order him politely to 
come to me right now at once.

Send coded messages to all borders 
with his description and photos.
Hans!
You should quit smoking!
Let me take a look at him again.

Ten minutes ago Shtirlitz 
had to stop his car.

He felt that he was falling asleep
while driving the car.

It was already ending the second day, 
as he was on his feet without a sleep.

He realized that he must have a nap 
for, at least, half-hour now.

Otherwise he'd never get to Berlin alive. 
At least a half-hour of sleep.

The first 10 minutes just passed. 
He was sleeping deeply and calmly.

But in exactly 20 minutes he will
wake up and start driving again.

This was one of his habits, which he 
mastered through the years of training.
 
412 
01:01:28,990 --> 01:01:36,833 
Yes, in 20 minutes he’ll wake up and
go to Berlin to continue his spy job.
End of part 8

Translated by Fooper01. Enjoy.
I love beer!

comments.author: Iskandar Ismagilov

comments.text:
avec mes souvenirs je alume le feu,
mes chagains, mes plaisires,
je n'ai plus besoin d'eux.
какая артикуляция у Пиаф-воробушка - можно все понять, почти не зная языка. 
А попробуйте понять, скажем, when I'm 64 Beatles? как там в конце: 
grandchildren on your knee: Vera, Jack, and Dave. ну-тко додуй!﻿

 - ничего" четкий ответ﻿

когда нибудь будет возможность обязательно спрошу как он относится к этой 
картине)﻿

comments.author: viktor smirnov

comments.text:
резидент не занимается шпионством и как правило известен контрразведке. 
Исаев был кротом, шпионом, но ни как не резидентом.
comments.author: viktor smirnov

comments.text:
главный герой фильма - Микаэл Таривердиев. Его гениальная музыка - мир, в 
котором происходят все эти события.
comments.author: Алексей Бакланов

comments.text:
On mog skazat', chto vipil aspirin, a na samom dele ne vipit'. Sami znaete, 
bog znaet, kto chto lopochet, a tem bolee v kino, da eshe v takom (imey 
vvidy sovetskii razvedchik v razgovore s natsistom)... A kon'yaka on ne tak 
mnogo vipil. Dlya myzgchini v rastsvete sil - da eshe kakih - eto erynda. I 
ne ves' alkogol v golovy daet.
comments.author: Amy

comments.text:
@darthlord1989 а ты прикинь, как у него мозг работает, если он изначально 
разведчик СССР, прикрывается разведчиком СС, и еще там принимает участие в 
секретной (предательской для Рейха) миссии по сотрудничеству Германии и 
США, и при всем этом, большую часть времени вокруг него уши и глаза 
внутреннего отдела.)
comments.author: Ivan Yermakov

comments.text:
легендарный фильм,а особенно эта серия,где Штирлиц так превосходно 
расправляется с Холлтофом с помощью логики. Единственное,что я не 
понимаю,как непьющий - как можно после приёма аспирина ещё коньяк 
принимать, да ещё потом к Мюллеру на автомобиле поехать. Вот зачем было 
такое показывать?
comments.author: Ellusion
